Authors:
Myung Soo Park, Jonathan J. Fong, Seung-Yoon Oh, Jos
Houbraken, Jae Hak Sohn, Seung-Beom Hong, Young Woon Lim
Title:
Penicillium jejuense sp. nov., isolated from the marine
environments of Jeju Island, Korea
Keywords:
New species Penicillium, Section Aspergilloides,
Phylogenetic analys
Abstract:
Three strains of an unidentified Penicillium species were
isolated during a fungal diversity survey of marine environments in
Korea. These strains are described here as a new species following a
multigene phylogenetic analyses of four loci, nuc rDNA internal
transcribed spacer barcodes (ITS1  5.8S  ITS2), β-tubulin, calmodulin,
and RNA polymerase II, and observation of macro- and micromorphological
characters. Phylogenetic analyses showed that the three strains formed a
strongly supported monophyletic group distinct from previously reported
species of section Aspergilloides. Morphologically, this species can be
distinguished from its sister species, P. crocicola, by the reverse
colour on Czapek yeast autolysate agar, abundant production of sclerotia
on malt extract agar, and colony characters on yeast extract sucrose
agar. We name this new species P. jejuense, after the locality where it
was discovered.
